title: Trump's new travel ban will be harder to challenge in court, but critics say it still targets Muslims
text: In the challenge to the original travel ban, the 9th Circuit Court of Appeals decided that the state of Washington may have "third party standing" to sue on behalf of professors and students who were barred from traveling. But because the new order does not restrict foreign nationals who have been in this country "for a continuous period of work, study or other long-term activity," that path into court may no longer be available.
summary:
In the challenge to the original travel ban, the 9th Circuit Court of Appeals decided that the state of Washington may have "third party standing" to sue on behalf of professors and students who were barred from traveling.
But because the new order does not restrict foreign nationals who have been in this country "for a continuous period of work, study or other long-term activity," that path into court may no longer be available.
